text_paragraphs: Information Note on the Court’s case-law No.

[This summary is extracted from the Court’s official reports (Series A or Reports of Judgments and Decisions). Its formatting and structure may therefore differ from the Case-Law Information Note summaries.]
I.	ARTICLE 6 § 1 OF THE CONVENTION ("reasonable time")
Starting-point: service of summons on defendant.
Close: filing of Court of Appeal's judgment.
Result: approximately six years and nine months.
Rasonableness of length of proceedings: to be assessed in light of particular circumstances of case, which in this instance called for an overall assessment.
Case somewhat complex and one adjournment due to parties, but between hearings the trial court allowed periods to elapse that were too long and was totally inactive for nearly two years.
In proceedings before Court: partial reimbursement.
Conclusion: respondent State to pay applicant a specified sum (unanimously).
